intro: Steganthera hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy stegmanther, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom during the rainy season. Its hairy stems and leaves are characteristic of the genus Steganthera. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest undergrowth.
